page.title: 10The Queen's visit to Kylesku
page.content: August the 8th 1984 was a very important day for Kylesku. For days before it was all hustle and bustle in preparation for the Queen's visit to open the new Kylesku Bridge. Early in the morning of the great day the Royal yacht, Britannia, could be seen at anchor in Loch a Chairn Bhain. People and cars were everywhere. Then the rain started and midges attacked from all sides. It was still raining when the Queen came ashore accompanied by Princess Margaret. They made the journey through the crowds up to the bridge where the opening ceremony was performed. The Assynt Pipe Band played as the Queen crossed the bridge to see the exhibition of its construction. To the strains of the bagpipes playing "The Waters of Kylesku", the Queen left on board the ferry.
